sage.display

Class DisplaySystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.display.DisplaySystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDisplaySystem

    public class DisplaySystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDisplaySystem
    DisplaySystem defines a display system that can be run in either full-screen or windowed mode and separates the package-specific rendering characteristics from the window (display) characteristics. The current implementation uses the Java Swing package for windowing support and class JOGLRenderer for rendering.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisplaySystem()
      This constructor defines a DisplaySystem with default characteristics: a 1024x768 windowed-mode (not fullscreen) display with 32-bit depth and a 60-Hz refresh rate which uses the SAGE JOGLRenderer class to handle display rendering.
      DisplaySystem(int w, int h, int depth, int rate, boolean isFullScreen, java.lang.String rendererClassName)
      This constructor defines a DisplaySystem with the specified width, height, depth, and refresh rate; parameter isFullScreen determines whether the display is full-screen or windowed, and the display uses as its renderer the class named by the specified rendererClassName parameter.

      • addKeyListener

        public void addKeyListener(java.awt.event.KeyListener k)
        addKeyListener() allows an application to add a KeyListener to the canvas being used by the DisplaySystem for rendering. It also issues a Component.requestFocus() request on behalf of the rendering canvas.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        k - -- the KeyListener to be added to the renderer's canvas

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String newTitle)
        Sets the title of the underlying frame used to render the display. Note that setting the title is only relevant for windowed-mode displays; full-screen mode does not include a title bar.
        Specified by:
        setTitle in interface IDisplaySystem
        Parameters:
        newTitle - -- the new title string

        the display's renderer

      • getCurrentDisplaySystem

        public static IDisplaySystem getCurrentDisplaySystem()
        Returns the most recently assigned IDisplaySystem.

      • isCreated

        public boolean isCreated()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the creation of this DisplaySystem has been completed. Note that completion of display system creation requires both completion of the DisplaySystem constructor AND completion of the supporting IRenderer, and that due to multi-threaded operations it is not necessarily the case that return from the DisplaySystem constructor implies completion and readiness of the entire DisplaySystem and its IRenderer. Applications should verify completion of a DisplaySystem by calling this method prior to actually using either the DisplaySystem or its IRenderer.
        Specified by:
        isCreated in interface IDisplaySystem
        Returns:
        -- a flag indicating whether or not the IDisplaySystem is fully created and ready for use

      • isShowing

        public boolean isShowing()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the frame being used by this DisplaySystem's IRenderer is currently showing on the screen.
        Specified by:
        isShowing in interface IDisplaySystem
        Returns:
        -- true if the window is showing on the screen

      • isFullScreen

        public boolean isFullScreen()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the frame being used by the DisplaySystem's IRenderer is currently running in FSEM (Full-Screen Exclusive Mode) or not.
        Specified by:
        isFullScreen in interface IDisplaySystem
        Returns:
        -- true if the DisplaySystem is in full-screen mode; false otherwise

      • setPredefinedCursor

        public void setPredefinedCursor(int cursor)
        Sets the mouse cursor on the frame used by the DisplaySystem to the predefined cursor represented by the specified integer. The integer must match one of the predefined field in Cursor.
        Specified by:
        setPredefinedCursor in interface IDisplaySystem
        See Also:
        Cursor

      • setCustomCursor

        public void setCustomCursor(java.lang.String fileName)
        Sets the mouse cursor on the frame used by the DisplaySystem to the image in the specified file. The file must be one of the image file types supported by ImageIcon class. If filename is null or an empty String, the cursor is set to be invisible. The position of the cursor is initially set to (0,0).
        Specified by:
        setCustomCursor in interface IDisplaySystem
        See Also:
        ImageIcon, Toolkit.createCustomCursor(Image, Point, String)

      • setCurrentDisplaySystem

        public static void setCurrentDisplaySystem(IDisplaySystem display)
        setCurrentDisplaySystem() assigns the specified IDisplaySystem to be the current display system.
        Parameters:
        display - - the DisplaySystem to be used as the current display system
